sen.j: 土御門 有脩（つちみかど ありすえ、大永7年（1527年） - 天正5年1月2日 (旧暦)（1577年1月20日））は、室町時代から安土桃山時代の公卿・陰陽家。
sen.e: Arisue TSUCHIMIKADO (1527-January 20, 1577) was a Kugyo (the top court official) and Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Muromachi period to the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

Arisue TSUCHIMIKADO (1527-January 20, 1577) was a Kugyo (top court official) and Inyoka (a practitioner of the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Muromachi Period to the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.

Arisue TSUCHIMIKADO (1527-January 20, 1577) was a Kugyo (top court official) and Inyoka (a practitioner of the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Muromachi Period to the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.

sen.j: 堂上家（家格は、半家 (公家)・阿倍氏）である、土御門家の30代目当主。
sen.e: He was the thirtieth family head of the TSUCHIMIKADO family which was Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) (the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the ABE clan).

He was the thirtieth family head of the TSUCHIMIKADO family which was Tosho-ke, or the hereditary lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks, of which the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the ABE clan.

He was the 30th family head of the Tsuchimikado family which was Tosho-ke, or the hereditary lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks, of which the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the Abe clan.
sen.cmt: 数字表記変更大文字表記を頭文字のみ大文字に訂正

sen.j: 陰陽頭（非参議従二位）・土御門有春の子。
sen.e: He was the child of Ariharu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) (non-Councilor, Junii (Junior Second Court Rank)).
He was the child of Ariharu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of the Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination), who was also a non-Councilor, Junii (Junior Second Court Rank).
He was the child of Ariharu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of the Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination), who was also Hisangi (advisor at large), Junii (Junior Second Court Rank).

sen.j: 実子に陰陽頭（非参議従三位）土御門久脩、准大臣・勧修寺晴豊の室（勧修寺光豊の母）らがいる。
sen.e: His biological children included Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (non-Councilor, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)) and the wife of Haretoyo KAJUJI (the mother of Mitsutoyo KAJUJI.), Jun-daijin (Vice Minister).

His biological children included Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami, non-Councilor, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and the wife of Haretoyo KAJUJI (the mother of Mitsutoyo KAJUJI), Jun-daijin (Vice Minister).

His biological children included Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami, Hisangi, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and the wife of Haretoyo KAJUJI (the mother of Mitsutoyo KAJUJI), Jun-daijin (Vice Minister).

sen.j: 官途は、陰陽頭、刑部卿・従三位（非参議）。
sen.e: His kanto (government service) was Onmyo no kami, Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice), Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) (non-Councilor).
His government service was as Onmyo no kami, Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice), Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), non-Councilor.
His government service was as Onmyo no kami, Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice), Jusanmi, Hisangi.
